intro: Raphionacme villicorona, commonly known as the silky bluebells, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine, silky hairs, contributing to its common name. The flowers bloom in late spring and early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
